# CKQueryOperation.Cursor

**Class**

An object that marks the stopping point for a query and the starting point for retrieving the remaining results.

## Declaration

```swift
class Cursor
```

## Overview

You don’t create instances of this class yourself. When fetching records using a query operation, if the number of results exceeds the limit for the query, CloudKit provides a cursor. Use that cursor to create a new instance of [doc://com.apple.cloudkit/documentation/CloudKit/CKQueryOperation] and retrieve the next batch of results for the same query.

For information about how to use a [doc://com.apple.cloudkit/documentation/CloudKit/CKQueryOperation/Cursor-swift.class] object, see [doc://com.apple.cloudkit/documentation/CloudKit/CKQueryOperation].

## Configuring the Query Operation

- **query**: The query for the search.
- **cursor**: The  cursor for continuing the search.
- **zoneID**: The ID of the record zone that contains the records to search.
- **resultsLimit**: The maximum number of records to return at one time.
- **maximumResults**: A constant value that represents the maximum number of results CloudKit retrieves.
- **desiredKeys**: The fields of the records to fetch.
